parser
Class Parser

java.lang.Object
  parser.Parser

public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object

Takes in input String and tokenizes this. Uses these tokens in a recursive parse tree to build and execute the commands as they are converted into their classes when building the tree.

Author:
carlosreyes, Kevin

parse

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> parse(java.lang.String input)
Splits user's input and passes it to the lexer. If user input contains invalid commands, will throw an exception

Parameters:
input - - String that user entered
Returns:
- List of Strings from user input

lexer

public java.util.List<Command> lexer(java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputs)
Makes a list of trees by storing their root, loops over all commands tokenized by the parse method, and calls treebuilder, putting the root in an array of roots.

Parameters:
inputs - - List of strings to make command tree out of

treeBuilder

public Command treeBuilder(Command root,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputs)
Recursively builds a tree of commands from a list of Strings. Creates instances of the appropriate classes when it encounters strings of the same name and executes the function of the classes.

Parameters:
root - - root Command whose children are to be added
Returns:
Command which is the root Node of the tree

specialTreeBuilder

public Command specialTreeBuilder(Command root,
                                  java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputs)
Recursively builds a tree of commands from a list of strings. Specifically handles commands with brackets as they must be treated slightly differently than other commands.

Parameters:
root - - root Command to add children and parameters to
inputs - - List of Strings that contain user input
Returns:
- returns built root command

root - - root Command to set CommandList of
inputs - - List of String of user inputs

findLastBracket

public int findLastBracket(int firstBracket,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputList)
Given the position of an open bracket in a string array, returns the position of the matching close bracket.

Parameters:
firstBracket - - int index of first bracket
inputList - - List of Strings
Returns:
- int of index of closing bracket

getClass

public Command getClass(java.lang.String className)
Creates a class from a string. If its a variable, make it of type variable and add its name to a map in model which maps the variable name (including the ':' to the value (which is set by default to 0. Otherwise a new command is created based on the String passed.

Parameters:
className - - String of name of class to be made
Returns:
A class that is a subclass of Command, based off of the string given.

customCommandHandler

public java.lang.String customCommandHandler(java.lang.String commandString)
Deals with custom commands from a command map and sends them through to the parser. Takes a commandstring if its first element was found not to be a valid class, and pulls it out of the custom command map, puts the value of the command in a string and replaces all of the parameters

Parameters:
commandString - - String to be considered

toClass

public java.lang.String toClass(java.lang.String in)
Gets file path from String that represents a class.

Parameters:
in - - String to make command with
Returns:
String that is the package path to that class.
